description.en:
The course will take a look at a selection of Shakespeare's Italian plays. They will be approached from the broader context of the Shakespeare Authorship Question that has recently, in the light of new findings and theories, acquired new topicality. As definite proof is now available that Shakespeare knew Italy intimately as only a person can who has lived and travelled there extensively, the orthodox view that the author of the plays was an almost illiterate Stratford Man who never left England and dreamed up his Italy based on hearsay in Southwark pubs is no longer sustainable. Likewise, two hundred years of thorough search in all sorts of records has resulted in a profile of the Stratford Man that is impossible to match to the plays. Also, the search for the man behind the pen name William Shakespeare has led to the discovery that there is an uncannily close affinity between the works and mindset of Edward de Vere, 17th Earl of Oxford, and Shakespeare as we known him from the plays and poems. His social status as a courtier, his exemplary education covering a wide range of fields, aristocratic interests and preoccupation with writing and theatre production (he ran his own company of players), plus the peculiar circumstances of his personal life, provide a credible and illuminating backdrop for the plays.
The course consists of seminars, in the course of which the plays would be discussed and then watched together, usually in a BBC version. To facilitate this, preparatory work at home includes reading the text of the play, plus additional background material, for which questions will be provided.
description.et:
Kursuse raames käsitletakse valikut Shakespeare'i Itaalia-teemalisi näidendeid. Neid vaadeldakse laiemas Shakespeare'i autorluse kontekstis, mis on hiljuti jälle päevakajaliseks muutunud seoses uute leidude ja teooriatega. Kuna nüüd on kindlaid tõendeid olemas sellest, et Shakespeare tundis Itaaliat nii hästi, kui võib tunda ainult inimene, kes on seal elanud ja laialdaselt reisinud, pole enam võimalik väita, et peaaegu kirjaoskamatu Stratfordi kaupmees, kes kunagi ei lahkunud Inglismaalt ja justkui mõtles välja oma Itaalia informatsiooni põhjal, mida ta kuulis teatrite umber asuvates kõrtsides, oli nende näidendite autor. Samuti on kakssada aastat intensiivseid otsinguid andud nn. Stratfordi mehest sellise pildi, mis mitte kuidagi ei sobitu Shakespeare'i näidenditega. Otsingud leidmaks autorit, kes võiks peituda pseudonüümi William Shakespeare taga on viinud avastuseni, et Edward de Vere'i, 17. Oxfordi krahvi looming, mida ta avaldas oma nime all, on ülimalt sarnane Shaekspeare'i omaga. Oxfordi ühiskondlik positsioon õukondlasena, tema hiiglav haridus, aristokraatlikud huvid ning pühendumine kirjutamisele ja teatrile (tal oli oma teatritrupp), pluss iseäralikud isikliku elu seigad annavad kokku usutava ja esimest korda paljusid asju selgitava tausta näidenditele.
Kursus koosneb seminaridest, mille käigus arutletakse iga näidendi teksti üle ja vaadatakse koos ära ka terve näidend, tavaliselt BBC versioonis. Eelnevalt on kodus tarvis peale näidendi enda ka läbi lugeda taustamaterjal, mille kohta on olemas ka abistavad küsimused.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce the students to Shakespeare's Italian plays.
objectives.et: Eesmärgiks on tutvustada üliõpilastele igakülgselt Shakespeare'i nn. Itaalia näidendeid.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course the students wild have familiarized themselves with the text and the context of the plays discussed, will have experienced the plays in performance and will be aware of the problems associated with the Shakespeare Authorship Question.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse lõpuks on üliõpilased tutvunud Shakespeare'i Itaalia-teemaliste näidendite teksti ja kontekstiga, on näinud neid näitlejate poolt esitatuna ja on saanud teadlikuks nn. Shakespeare'i autorluse küsimuse olemusest.

independent_work.et: The home assignment will consist in reading the materials for each session in order to participate in the discussion in class.

grade_preconditions.et: To qualify for the exam you will have to attend at least 80% of the sessions,  i.e. you have to be present at 8 sessions out of 10, not including the introductory lecture.

grade_evaluation.et: The exam will take place in class. A selection of 4 questions will be made from among the questions you prepared for sessions in class and you will write answers to them using all your materials.

debt_elimination.et: A repeat exam will take place.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: Course materials can be found at sisu.ut.ee/pilvirajamae. The file Questions for Sessions will provide detailed instructions for each session.
